title: Incremental ~run on 0.13.16 with 2.6.6 can't 'obtain files to watch'
body:
Play Version 2.6.6 (sbt 0.13.16)
Scala 2.12.2
OS OSX
JDK (javac 1.8.0_60)

This can be demonstrated on [play-scala-starter-example](https://github.com/playframework/play-scala-starter-example) by setting the sbt version to `0.13.16`.

### Expected Behavior

1. `sbt ~run` should compile without an error

### Actual Behavior
```
% sbt ~run
[info] Loading global plugins from /Users/andy/.sbt/0.13/plugins
[info] Loading project definition from /Users/andy/projects/play-scala-starter-example/project
[info] Set current project to play-scala-starter-example (in build file:/Users/andy/projects/play-scala-starter-example/)

--- (Running the application, auto-reloading is enabled) ---

[info] p.c.s.AkkaHttpServer - Listening for HTTP on /0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0:9000

(Server started, use Enter to stop and go back to the console...)

[error] Error occurred obtaining files to watch.  Terminating continuous execution...
[info] p.c.s.AkkaHttpServer - Stopping server...

[success] Total time: 4 s, completed Oct 6, 2017 4:42:54 PM
1. Waiting for source changes... (press enter to interrupt)
```
### Reproducible Test Case

See above 

---

Note: This worked in 2.6.5, I think this stems from the sbt 1.0 PR compat but I'm not sure https://github.com/playframework/playframework/commit/f014439ee696a56baa14b75591e5c96cc3500718#diff-df3eb319d0616dd90e49ec8d062b9091 (PlayRunCompat.scala) cc @marcospereira 
The exception is caught here: https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/f014439ee696a56baa14b75591e5c96cc3500718/framework/src/sbt-plugin/src/main/scala/play/sbt/run/PlayRun.scala#L146-L154
